meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: GIVE IT UP L.A.
Next time you complain about being stuck in traffic, spare a thought for the drivers in Brazil's biggest city, which has some of the worst congestion problems in the world.

li.div: Sao Paolo: a city so congested, air taxis are commercially viable. bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-19...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Omt1DM&via=Digg&text=The City With 180km Traffic Jams

div.div: MAP WARS

div.a: Apple Had Over A Year Left On Google Maps Contract, What Happened?

div.div: Apple's decision to ship its own mapping system in the iPhone 5 and iOS 6 was made over a year before the company's agreement to use Google Maps expired, according to two independent sources familiar with the matter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OSYHR0&via=Digg&text=Apple Had Over A Year Left On Google Maps Contract, What Happened?

div.div: PRESIDENTIAL SHINERS

div.a: Did Someone Give Obama A Black Eye?

div.div: The four times President Obama has gone on TV in the last six days, as he did this morning when he spoke to the United Nations General Assembly, cameras showed what looks like he has a black eye. Or at least one that has been covered up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sw16S6&via=Digg&text=Did Someone Give Obama A Black Eye?

div.div: SODA CANS USED TO SUCK

div.a: The Brilliant Redesign Of The Soda Can Tab

div.div: "As a child of the 1970s, I have a distinct and curious memory about the landscapes I inhabited: They glittered with glinting metal, not the gold of El Dorado but the effluvia of the consumer society. I am talking about aluminum can tabs."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OV1TWE&via=Digg&text=The Brilliant Redesign Of The Soda Can Tab

div.div: WITCHES HAVE NOTHING ON VAMPIRES

div.a: The Great New England Vampire Panic

div.div: “Ever heard of the Jewett City vampires?”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RSLMze&via=Digg&text=The Great New England Vampire Panic

div.div: SOUNDS... DANGEROUS

div.a: The Man Who Built A 30-Story Building 15 Days

div.div: In late 2011, Broad Sustainable Building built a 30-story building in 15 days; now it intends to use similar methods to erect the world’s tallest building in just seven months.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UNExrm&via=Digg&text=The Man Who Built A 30-Story Building 15 Days

div.div: LIGHT PAINTING

div.a: Light Paints Beautiful Pictures On NYC Streets In The 1970s

div.div: Light painting has become quite trendy as a photography project as of late, but it’s by no means a new idea.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Omd404&via=Digg&text=Light Paints Beautiful Pictures On NYC Streets In The 1970s

div.div: WHAT DOES IT MEAN?

div.a: NASA Captures An Elusive Double Rainbow Just For A Facebook Post

div.div: NASA continues to spend money in the most awesome ways possible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S1dSmp&via=Digg&text=NASA Captures An Elusive Double Rainbow Just For A Facebook Post

div.a: Where Americans Go To Hate Muslims

div.div: Dearborn, a city of 97,000 surrounded on three sides by Detroit, is a must-visit location on 21st-century America's newly established anti-Muslim protest circuit. The entire city, right-wing critics erroneously claim, is subject to Sharia law. And they warn that the rest of America might soon be, too.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QhwodL&via=Digg&text=Where Americans Go To Hate Muslims

div.div: POOR INDIA

div.a: How Long Do You Have To Work To Afford A Beer?

div.div: At the bottom of the pint glass, low wages and high taxes mean that boozers in India must toil for nearly an hour before they have earned enough to quench their thirst.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PBylQj&via=Digg&text=How Long Do You Have To Work To Afford A Beer?

div.div: UNBELIEVABLE

div.a: Driver Walks Away From Insane Head-On Collision

div.div: bloomberg.com - via @KatyFinneran
Luck doesn't even begin to describe what this guy just went through.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S392VL&via=Digg&text=Driver Walks Away From Insane Head-On Collision

div.div: THIS WILL BE INTERESTING

div.a: Biz Stone, Ron Howard Oversee A Tweeted Movie

div.div: They've made so many movies inspired by eating. They've made movies inspired by dancing dirty. Surely there had to come a time when there'd be a movie inspired by twittering.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NNCjHl&via=Digg&text=Biz Stone, Ron Howard Oversee A Tweeted Movie

div.div: IRL TROLLS
A man whose life was turned into a virtual hell by an anti-Semitic troll on Twitter hunts down his tormenter and confronts him.

li.div: This was absolutely horrific and upsetting. Read now: RT @andrea_mclean: Leo Traynor meets his troll. traynorseye.com/2012/09/me... #toughstuff

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vzs1LM&via=Digg&text=My Neighbor, My Troll

div.div: MONEY DOESN'T BUY DRUGS, PEOPLE DO

I was hoping that I wouldn’t have to write this, but it just keeps happening. Bitcoin — the most successful electronic currency — is consistently framed as being amoral. Let’s think about why currencies are not compatible with morality.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OmTCR6&via=Digg&text=Bitcoin And Morality

div.a: The Glitchy Inhabitants Of Google Street View Recreated In Real Life

div.div: We’ve all heard the cliche about art imitating life, but how about art imitating Street View imitating life?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QiEF17&via=Digg&text=The Glitchy Inhabitants Of Google Street View Recreated In Real Life

div.div: TERRIBLE

div.a: Rent-To-Own Laptops Secretly Photographed Users Having Sex

div.div: Seven rent-to-own companies and a software maker are settling charges with the Federal Trade Commission that rental computers illegally used spyware that took “pictures of children, individuals not fully clothed, and couples engaged in sexual activities.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwYKmc&via=Digg&text=Rent-To-Own Laptops Secretly Photographed Users Having Sex

div.div: ALREADY?!
“We are looking at science fiction becoming reality in a self-driving car,” Brown said.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OolzYw&via=Digg&text=Self-Driving Cars Legalized In California

div.div: COLOR ON THE BRAIN
Have you ever wondered why most restaurants used the color ‘red’ in their logos, or why the color ‘black’ is often associated with death?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qvr1Ye&via=Digg&text=The Psychology Of Color

div.div: SCRATCH GATE

div.a: iPhone 5 Owners Discover Aluminum Is Softer Than Glass

div.div: The iPhone 4 was a magnet for fingerprints. The iPhone 5 attracts scratches and scrapes nearly as easily.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QtHsV0&via=Digg&text=iPhone 5 Owners Discover Aluminum Is Softer Than Glass

div.div: CIRCUMCISION
How an anti-circumcision fringe group waged an ideological attack against AIDS scholarship.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NMUhtx&via=Digg&text=Amazon Warfare

div.div: YOUR BEARD WILL NEVER LOOK LIKE THIS

div.a: Best Of 2012 European Beard And Moustache Championships

div.div: Over 100 men with the wildest whiskers entered the 2012 European Beard and Moustache Championships in Wittersdorf, France over this past weekend.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PgwgIs&via=Digg&text=Best Of 2012 European Beard And Moustache Championships

div.div: WHAT FROM 'RIGHT NOW' IS STILL RIGHT NOW?

div.a: Things From Billy Joel's 'We Didn't Start The Fire' That Are Still Burning

div.div: When we are gone, will it still burn on, and on, and on, and on?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PDLQPI&via=Digg&text=Things From Billy Joel's 'We Didn't Start The Fire' That Are Still Burning

div.div: TOM STRIKES FROM BEYOND THE GRAVE

div.a: Apple Denied Trademark For Music Icon Thanks To... MySpace

div.div: Apple lost an appeal to protect its famous music icon after trademark judges ruled that consumers were likely to confuse with it a mark now owned by MySpace.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PWU4Cf&via=Digg&text=Apple Denied Trademark For Music Icon Thanks To... MySpace

div.div: PERFECT IS THE ENEMY OF GOOD

Our insecurity is getting the best of us. “The big problem in general is fear,” he says. “To counter their fear, companies make their standards too high and turn down people who would be great at their jobs."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sjcrzj&via=Digg&text=Shattering The Engineering Shortage Myth
